_header: When that Phoebus beams shining as gold
_description: ‘Trust not the ontrustye for hys promysse ys not sure’ — twelve 8-line stanzas with this refrain

BLCottCleoCIV.First Lines:
Whan that phebus beemes schynyng as goldeGan to ylumyne over every
                    nacyon…
BLCottCleoCIV.Last Lines:
…Then schall we haue the Ioye that all Ioyes doth exsellTrust
                    hym that ys trusty hys promys ys sure
BLCottCleoCIV.Editions:
Sandison,  Helen Estabrook. 
             The ‘Chanson d’Aventure’ in Middle English.
Bryn Mawr College Monographs,  Monograph Series 12. Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1913: 123-6.
